thread.title: 'More widespread and heavy snow' heading our way tonight and tomorrow - Manchester Evening News
thread.title_full: 'More widespread and heavy snow' heading our way tonight and tomorrow - Manchester Evening News

author: Charlotte Green
title: 'More widespread and heavy snow' heading our way tonight and tomorrow - Manchester Evening News
text:
'More widespread and heavy snow' heading our way tonight and tomorrow The Met Office have extended their yellow weather warning and are predicting heavier snow on Sunday Share Click to play Tap to play The video will start in 8 Cancel Play now Get daily updates directly to your inbox + Subscribe Could not subscribe, try again later Invalid Email 
It looks like it’s going to snow on Saturday night and into Sunday. 
The Met Office has issued a weather warning for Greater Manchester. 
It says that after sleet on and off over Saturday: “During Sunday an area of more widespread and at times heavy snow (rain or sleet at lower levels) is expected to develop along the Pennine chain, with drifting of snow in the strong northeasterly winds.” 
“Some temporary slushy accumulations are possible down to 150 metres early on Sunday, with 2-5 cm likely above 250 metres and possibly 10-15 cm above 350 metres. The snow will drift in the strengthening winds.” Read More 
The yellow weather warning adds that transport routes and travel services may be affected. 
It comes into force at 9pm on Saturday and lasts until 3pm on Sunday. 
This weekend is one of the chilliest so far this year with temperatures just above freezing. Most of the country is bitterly cold with outbreaks of sleet and snow. 
People with elderly relatives or neighbours are being asked to keep an eye on them and make sure homes are prepared for the cold snap. Read More
